snippet: A lifetime of eye problems leads to an odd question from a specialist.
abstract: Lisa Sanders Diagnosis column describes the difficult diagnosis of a woman with a swollen nerve in her eye, which turned out to be a symptom of acromegaly, disease caused by a small tumor in the pituitary gland. (M)
lead_paragraph: ''Are your eyes more deep-set now than they used to be?''Dr. Robert Lesser asked the middle-aged woman in his office. She was surprised by the odd question from this eye doctor she just met. Why would he ask me that? she wondered ''No,'' the woman told him, ''I don't think so.'' A HISTORY OF EYE PROBLEMS
